docs.snippet: The Enron Corporation held up the release of details of the sale of its energy trading business yesterday as its lawyers continued to work on the text of agreements with UBS, which won a bidding war with Citigroup, BP and an undisclosed fourth bid...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Enron Corporation held up the release of details of the sale of its energy trading business yesterday as its lawyers continued to work on the text of agreements with UBS, which won a bidding war with Citigroup, BP and an undisclosed fourth bidder to buy the unit last week. A lawyer for Enron, which filed for reorganization under Chapter 11 of the bankruptcy law last month, said that the delay did not reflect substantive changes in the transaction, under which Enron would receive a percentage of profits earned by the trading business rising from 33 percent to 45 percent over 10 years.
docs.abstract: Enron Corp holds up release of details of sale of its energy trading business as its lawyers continue to work on text of agreements with UBS, successful bidder; Enron lawyer says delay does not reflect substantive changes in transaction, under which Enron will receive percentage of profits earned by trading business rising from 33 percent to 45 percent over 10 years (M)

headline.main: Details of a Trading Unit's Sale Are Delayed

docs.snippet: Wall Street found nothing but good news in Dynegy's $9 billion takeover of the Enron Corporation yesterday.    Three days after Dynegy, an energy marketing and trading company based in Houston, agreed to take over Enron, its giant crosstown rival,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Wall Street found nothing but good news in Dynegy's $9 billion takeover of the Enron Corporation yesterday. Three days after Dynegy, an energy marketing and trading company based in Houston, agreed to take over Enron, its giant crosstown rival, Dynegy executives came to New York to assure investors that the deal would sharply increase their company's profits. They met a receptive audience.
docs.abstract: Wall Street finds nothing but good news in Dynegy's $9 billion takeover of Enron Corp; Dynegy executives go to New York to assure investors that deal will sharply increase their company's profits; Dynegy stock closes at $44.31, up $5.55, or 14.3 percent; Enron closes at $9.24, up 61 cents, or 7.1 percent; photo (M)

headline.main: Suitor for Enron Receives Approval From Wall St.

docs.snippet: Only 18 months after it sold stock in the Azurix Corporation to the public, the Enron Corporation agreed yesterday to repurchase the stock for less than half of what the public paid.    Enron, an electricity, natural gas and communications company...
docs.lead_paragraph: Only 18 months after it sold stock in the Azurix Corporation to the public, the Enron Corporation agreed yesterday to repurchase the stock for less than half of what the public paid. Enron, an electricity, natural gas and communications company, and Azurix, a water company whose plans for global expansion did not work out, said that the deal was unanimously approved by the board of Azurix, all of whom are also Enron directors.
docs.abstract: Enron Corp agrees to repurchase stock in Azurix Corp at $8.375 a share, well below $19 price investors paid when Azurix went public in June 1999; Azurix shares rise to $8.06; cost to Enron will be $330 million (M)

headline.main: Enron to Buy Back a Stock Issue at Half What Public Paid

docs.snippet: The web of interlocking directorates can produce some odd situations, particularly when one company totally dominates another company's board.    Consider the three directors of the Azurix Corporation who were named yesterday to the special commit...
docs.lead_paragraph: The web of interlocking directorates can produce some odd situations, particularly when one company totally dominates another company's board. Consider the three directors of the Azurix Corporation who were named yesterday to the special committee of the Azurix board that will determine whether the company should approve a proposal from the Enron Corporation to take Azurix private for $7 a share.
docs.abstract: Market Place column on three directors of Azurix Corp who are named to special committee of Azurix Corp board that will determine whether company should approve proposal from Enron Corp to take Azurix private for $7 a share; they are Herbert S Winokur Jr, John H Duncan and Lord Wakeham, all members of Enron board; Azurix spokeswoman Diane Bazelides holds none of men are executives of Enron, as are other Azurix directors, and adds that committee has retained laawyers and investment bankers who are independent of Enron; Enron spokesman Mark Palmer says the three men have not participated in Enron board's discussions regarding whether to make proposal will stay out of future Enron deliberations on matter, but they remain on the board (M)

headline.main: THE MARKETS: Market Place; Corporate Family Ties That Bind Tight

docs.lead_paragraph: The director Rupert Goold narrates a look at  a scene from the new Broadway show.

docs.snippet: The Enron Corporation has signed a letter of intent with the state-owned Qatar General Petroleum Corporation to develop a liquefied-natural-gas project that may export gas to Israel and India.   Enron, based here, declined to comment on reports va...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Enron Corporation has signed a letter of intent with the state-owned Qatar General Petroleum Corporation to develop a liquefied-natural-gas project that may export gas to Israel and India. Enron, based here, declined to comment on reports valuing the project at roughly $4 billion, saying that too many specifics of the proposal were still to be negotiated.

docs.snippet: The Enron Corporation of Houston and the state-owned Qatar General Petroleum Corporation are close to an agreement to set up a liquefied natural gas export venture, the Middle East Economic Survey said yesterday.   The Survey, an oil industry news...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Enron Corporation of Houston and the state-owned Qatar General Petroleum Corporation are close to an agreement to set up a liquefied natural gas export venture, the Middle East Economic Survey said yesterday. The Survey, an oil industry newsletter, said Enron wants to market its natural gas products in India and Israel.

docs.snippet: Kenneth L. Lay and Jeffrey K. Skilling, the former Enron executives, asked a judge on Wednesday to move their coming trial out of Houston, arguing that nearly all potential jurors there are biased against them.      About 244 of 280 potential juro...
docs.lead_paragraph: Kenneth L. Lay and Jeffrey K. Skilling, the former Enron executives, asked a judge on Wednesday to move their coming trial out of Houston, arguing that nearly all potential jurors there are biased against them. About 244 of 280 potential jurors indicated in questionnaires that they held negative views of Mr. Lay, Enron's former chairman, and Mr. Skilling, the former chief executive.

docs.snippet: Barry Bonds put up some impressive numbers at Enron Field last season.    His only appearance there this season starts Tuesday night, and it finds Bonds with a real chance at Mark McGwire's major league home run record....
docs.lead_paragraph: Barry Bonds put up some impressive numbers at Enron Field last season. His only appearance there this season starts Tuesday night, and it finds Bonds with a real chance at Mark McGwire's major league home run record.
docs.abstract: San Francisco Giants will play Houston Astros and Barry Bonds continues his quest for home run record (S)

docs.snippet: The Enron Corporation, the new name for the company created by the merger of the Houston Natural Gas Corporation and Internorth Inc., said it was combining the two companies' pension plans in a move that will yield $130 million after taxes. Formed...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Enron Corporation, the new name for the company created by the merger of the Houston Natural Gas Corporation and Internorth Inc., said it was combining the two companies' pension plans in a move that will yield $130 million after taxes. Formed last July, Enron, based in Omaha, is primarily engaged in the transmission and sales of natural gas in North America.
